title: Describing Modern Banking

sections.title: Vocabulary: Describing Services & Tools
sections.content:
In modern finance, we use these adjectives to describe our tools:

- **New / Modern**: Latest technology (neobanks).
- **Old / Traditional**: Classic methods (physical branches).
- **Fast / High-speed**: Quick transactions and internet.
- **Slow / Laggy**: Systems that take a long time.
- **Secure**: Safe from hackers (encrypted).
- **User-friendly**: Easy to use (apps).
- **Large / Small**: Describing the size of an office or a budget.

sections.title: Traditional vs. Modern Banking
sections.content:
```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Traditional] --> B[Paper-based]
    B --> C[Slow & Manual]
    D[Modern] --> E[Digital-first]
    E --> F[Fast & Automatic]
```

sections.title: Combining Adjectives with Nouns
sections.content:
To describe something, put the adjective **before** the noun:

- *This is a **secure** app.*
- *That is a **traditional** bank.*
- *We have a **user-friendly** interface.*
- *Those are **fast** computers.*

objectives: Describe financial products using modern and traditional adjectives
Identify the quality of digital services (secure, fast, user-friendly)
Correctly place adjectives before nouns in sentences
